As part of their regulatory oversight processes, insurance regulators conduct periodic examinations of our insurance subsidiaries . Dividends in excess of certain prescribed limits are considered to be extraordinary dividends and require prior approval or non- disapproval from the applicable insurance regulator . Outside the U.S., insurers, subject to certain exceptions, are permitted to pay dividends subject to maintaining prescribed capital and solvency requirements .
 The NAIC is not a regulator, but it assists state insurance regulators in establishing standards and best practices . Model laws and regulations promulgated by the NAIC only become effective in a state once formally adopted by such state and are subject to revision by each state . Examples of NAIC models adopted in substantial part by all states include the Risk-Based Capital for Insurers Model Act .
 The New York State Department of Financial Services (NYDFS) is AIG’s lead U.S.-state regulator . NYDFS leads AIG's Supervisory College meetings, which consist of key global regulators . The NAIC also provides standardized insurance industry accoieties, including insurance commissioners .
 The NAIC has undertaken a multi-pronged effort to determine whether additional standards, safeguards or disclosures are required in connection with certain investments by U.S. insurance companies . In December 2020, the NAIC amended the Holding Company Models to incorporate a Group Capital Calculation (GCC) requirement . The GCC is intended to serve as an analytical tool for evaluating a firm’s capital position .
 Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (Dodd-Frank) established the Federal Insurance Office (FIO) to serve as the central insurance authority in the federal government . FIO also assists the Secretary of the Treasury in administering the U.S. Terrorism Risk Insurance Act (TRIA) through December 31, 2027 .
 Title V of Dodd-Frank authorizes the U.S. to enter into covered agreements with foreign governments or regulatory entities regarding the business of insurance and reinsurance . Title VII provides for significantly increased regulation of, and restrictions on, derivatives markets and transactions . Under the agreements, AIG is subject to consolidated group supervision .
 In the UK, the Prudential Regulation Authority is the lead prudential supervisor for our UK insurance operations . The Financial Conduct Authority has oversight of AIG’s insurance operations for consumer protection and competition matters . The Luxembourg insurance regulator is the insurance regulator for AIG Europe SA, which serves our European Economic Area (EEA) and Swiss policyholders .
 The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) supervises AIG’s insurance subsidiary in Singapore . The Japan Financial Services Agency (JFSA) regulates AIG's operating insurance subsidiaries and insurance holding company in Japan . The failure to maintain an appropriate SMR could result in the JFSA imposing corrective actions on our operations .
 The International Association of Insurance Supervisors (IAIS) represents insurance regulators and supervisors of more than 200 jurisdictions (including regions and states) in nearly 140 countries . The FSB is not a regulator but is focused primarily on promoting international financial stability . One of its activities is to develop insurance regulatory standards for use by local authorities across the globe .
 Starting in December 2024 the FSB began publishing an annual list of insurers, including AIG, that are subject to resolution planning requirements . The FSB has also been engaging with member jurisdictions in order to encourage greater adherence to its “Key Attributes for Effective Resolution Regimes for the Insurance Sector” to ensure that large, internationally active insurers can exit the market in an orderly fashion and avoid the need for taxpayer bailouts .
 We are subject to various laws and regulations that require financial institutions and other businesses to protect and safeguard personal and other sensitive information . In the European Union, the EU Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA) will require covered entities to comply with a wide range of organizational and technical requirements to identify, manage and mitigate operational risk arising from use of network and information systems .
 The State of California has updated its privacy laws . The law does not apply to personal information collected, processed, or disclosed . The laws are similar to those imposed by the federal Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (FPA) and the California Financial Information Privacy Act (CFPPA) The law was passed in November 1, 2023 .
 The EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) scope extends to entities established within the EEA . Sanctions for non-compliance with the GDPR are onerous, with the potential for fines of up to 4 percent of global revenue . The GDPR was also onshored in the UK through the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018 .
 The NAIC and certain U.S. states have adopted or are considering regulations and guidance relating to the use of “big data,” AI, machine learning and other technology innovations in the insurance marketplace . European countries, and supranational political organizations like the EU and the Council of Europe, are expected to continue taking an active role in regulating AI in ways that may impact the insurance industry .
 Federal and state-level lawmakers and regulators in the U.S. have increased their scrutiny on financial institutions’ and other companies’ governance, risk oversight, disclosures, plans, policies and practices in connection with climate change . Regulators in several jurisdictions are considering the so-called protection gap as it relates to climate – instances in which populations are under-insured or there is insufficient coverage to protect policyholders .
